definition: to fail (a student)/to pawn/(of a computer or program) to crash/to stop working
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: This kind of program makes discharge of a few websites is overweighted and pawn.
sentences.chinese: 這種程序使得一些網站流量超載而當掉了。

sentences.english: You will be in the danger of failing the course if you exceed four absences.
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺席超過四次，這個科目你將有被當掉的危險。

sentences.english: In spite of my wonderful cheating techniques, I flunck math.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我有美妙的作弊技巧，我的數學還是被當掉了。

sentences.english: Her watch had been pawned a second time, and she had no other means of obtaining money.
sentences.chinese: 她的表是第二次又當掉了，此外她再沒有弄錢的方法。

sentences.english: Crazy about whodunits his year, he was flunked.
sentences.chinese: 因爲今年來迷著看偵探小說，他被當掉了。

sentences.english: He's probably pawned it till next pay day.
sentences.chinese: 他也許把他當掉了，到下次發薪日再把它贖回來。

sentences.english: A few of people were browsing in the bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 這位被當掉之學生需要一些個別指導。

sentences.english: The tutor flayed the idle students.
sentences.chinese: 這位被當掉之學生需要一些個別指導。

sentences.english: I might have to pawn more stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我可能必須當掉更多的東西。

sentences.english: Ask the student who has failed a class.
sentences.chinese: 問那位剛被當掉的學生。

sentences.english: He pawned the watch Eliza had given him upon his birthday.
sentences.chinese: 他把意萊莎給他作生日禮物的金錶當掉了。

sentences.english: I’ve got just five sous in the world, and I’ve pawned everything.
sentences.chinese: 我總共只有五個蘇，啥都當掉了。

sentences.english: And sometimes he didn't have the money to get back what he had pawned.
sentences.chinese: 好幾次，他無錢贖回自己當掉的東西。

sentences.english: And who did the selling and the pawning?
sentences.chinese: 當掉了。“”是誰去替她賣的？

sentences.english: Pawned his wedding ring; bought drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他當掉結婚戒指去買毒品。

definition: lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
crybaby
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
(not) a single person/(no) one
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
foolish talk/nonsense
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
